definition: to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)

sentences.english: My English-Chinese Dictionary has disappeared. Who could have taken it?
sentences.chinese: 我的叶英汉词典曳不见了，谁可能把它拿走了呢？

sentences.english: I saw the book taken away (by him).
We take your bags and send them in all directions。
sentences.chinese: 我们将拿走您的行李，送往四面八方。

sentences.english: I know you take things like this.
sentences.chinese: 我知道你会拿走这类东西。

sentences.english: Did he take away the jade bracelets and agate necklace i gave you last week ?
sentences.chinese: 他有没有拿走上个礼拜我给你的玉镯子和玛瑙项链？

sentences.english: He slunk into his parent's room and took the car keys.
sentences.chinese: 他偷偷溜进父母的房间而且拿走了车钥匙。

sentences.english: The boss demanded a kickback on her wages.
sentences.chinese: 老板要从她的薪金中拿走回扣。

sentences.english: You sneak a flask up there and raise a toast to the whole city of New York.
sentences.chinese: 在楼上偷偷拿走一个扁酒瓶，向整个纽约城敬上一杯。

sentences.english: Biro claimed to me that an assistant had given him permission to take it.
sentences.chinese: 比罗则向我声称是一位助手允许他拿走火柴。

sentences.english: Have another little piece of my heart now, baby.
sentences.chinese: 现在就拿走我的另一片心。

sentences.english: I think it is acceptable that parents take all the New Year money from young kids.
sentences.chinese: 我认为父母拿走小孩子全部的压岁钱是能接受的。

sentences.english: You’ll have total control and no-one can take it away from you.
sentences.chinese: 你需要全部的控制权，而且没有人能拿走它。

sentences.english: Take this empty box away and bring me a full one.
sentences.chinese: 把空盒子拿走，拿一个满的来。

definition: to snatch (esp related to a robbery)
to take possession of/to get hold of
to return something to its rightful owner
to take out/to put out/to provide/to put forward (a proposal)/to come up with (evidence)
to hold/to seize/to catch/to apprehend/to take/(used in the same way as 把[ba3]: to mark the following noun as a direct object)
